item.title: Robert Kraft to discuss tensions with Bill Belichick, Tom Brady after season
item.description: The three men most responsible for turning the New England Patriots into a perennial power will wait until after the season to settle any differences.
item.media:description: The three men most responsible for turning the New England Patriots into a perennial power will wait until after the season to settle any differences.
item.media:title: Robert Kraft to discuss tensions with Bill Belichick, Tom Brady after season

item.title: Protesters trash South African H&M stores over monkey hoodie
item.description: Members of an opposition party stormed into South African H&M stores on Saturday, ransacking and trashing stores in retaliation of a monkey hoodie.
item.media:description: Members of an opposition party stormed into South African H&M stores on Saturday, ransacking and trashing stores in retaliation of a monkey hoodie.
item.media:title: Protesters trash South African H&M stores over monkey hoodie

item.title: USMNT legend Landon Donovan unretires, joins Liga MX
item.description: United States Men's National Team soccer legend Landon Donovan is returning to the 'beautiful game.'
item.media:description: United States Men's National Team soccer legend Landon Donovan is returning to the 'beautiful game.'
item.media:title: USMNT legend Landon Donovan unretires, joins Liga MX

item.title: Minnesota Vikings activate QB Sam Bradford off injured reserve
item.description: The Minnesota Vikings activated quarterback Sam Bradford off injured reserve, the team announced on Saturday.
item.media:description: The Minnesota Vikings activated quarterback Sam Bradford off injured reserve, the team announced on Saturday.
item.media:title: Minnesota Vikings activate QB Sam Bradford off injured reserve

item.title: AMC renews 'Walking Dead' for Season 9
item.description: AMC says it has ordered a ninth season of its zombie-apocalypse drama "The Walking Dead" to premiere in late 2018.
item.media:description: AMC says it has ordered a ninth season of its zombie-apocalypse drama "The Walking Dead" to premiere in late 2018.
item.media:title: AMC renews 'Walking Dead' for Season 9

item.title: Mark Wahlberg donating $1.5M to the Time's Up Legal Defense Fund
item.description: Mark Wahlberg tweeted Saturday that he is donating $1.5 million to the Time's Up Legal Defense Fund.
item.media:description: Mark Wahlberg tweeted Saturday that he is donating $1.5 million to the Time's Up Legal Defense Fund.
item.media:title: Mark Wahlberg donating $1.5M to the Time's Up Legal Defense Fund

item.title: Women in Saudi Arabia attend first soccer game under new law
item.description: For the first time in the country's history, women in Saudi Arabia were allowed inside of a sports stadium to watch a professional soccer game.
item.media:description: For the first time in the country's history, women in Saudi Arabia were allowed inside of a sports stadium to watch a professional soccer game.
item.media:title: Women in Saudi Arabia attend first soccer game under new law

item.title: Study IDs bacteria and fungi found in dishwashers
item.description: Your dishwasher may get those plates spotless, but it is also probably teeming with bacteria and fungus, a new study suggests.
item.media:description: Your dishwasher may get those plates spotless, but it is also probably teeming with bacteria and fungus, a new study suggests.
item.media:title: Study IDs bacteria and fungi found in dishwashers

item.title: Ex-high school classmate arrested in death of UPenn student
item.description: A former high school classmate of a University of Pennsylvania sophomore was arrested after the 19-year-old was found dead in Southern California.
item.media:description: A former high school classmate of a University of Pennsylvania sophomore was arrested after the 19-year-old was found dead in Southern California.
item.media:title: Ex-high school classmate arrested in death of UPenn student

item.title: At least 773 detained in protests in Tunisia
item.description: At least 773 protesters demonstrating against austerity measures in Tunisia are in custody after vandalism and looting committed throughout the nation.
item.media:description: At least 773 protesters demonstrating against austerity measures in Tunisia are in custody after vandalism and looting committed throughout the nation.
item.media:title: At least 773 detained in protests in Tunisia

item.title: Hawaiians jarred by false alarm of ballistic missile threat
item.description: A false alarm early Saturday shook up Hawaiians as a cell phone alert was sent warning islanders of a ballistic missile threat.
item.media:description: A false alarm early Saturday shook up Hawaiians as a cell phone alert was sent warning islanders of a ballistic missile threat.
item.media:title: Hawaiians jarred by false alarm of ballistic missile threat

item.title: IFC orders third season of 'Stan Against Evil'
item.description: IFC has renewed its horror-comedy "Stan Against Evil" for a third season.
item.media:description: IFC has renewed its horror-comedy "Stan Against Evil" for a third season.
item.media:title: IFC orders third season of 'Stan Against Evil'

item.title: Islamic State affiliate says it attacked U.S. soldiers in Niger
item.description: An Islamic State affiliate claimed responsibility for an attacked three months ago in Niger that killed four American soldiers on patrol with Nigerien forces.
item.media:description: An Islamic State affiliate claimed responsibility for an attacked three months ago in Niger that killed four American soldiers on patrol with Nigerien forces.
item.media:title: Islamic State affiliate says it attacked U.S. soldiers in Niger

item.title: Three churches firebombed in Chile before pope's arrival
item.description: Three churches were hit by firebombs in Santiago, Chile, three days before Pope Francis' visit to the South American country, authorities reported.
item.media:description: Three churches were hit by firebombs in Santiago, Chile, three days before Pope Francis' visit to the South American country, authorities reported.
item.media:title: Three churches firebombed in Chile before pope's arrival

item.title: Report: Oakland Raiders to hire Tom Cable as offensive line coach
item.description: Tom Cable is on the verge of returning to the Bay Area.
item.media:description: Tom Cable is on the verge of returning to the Bay Area.
item.media:title: Report: Oakland Raiders to hire Tom Cable as offensive line coach

item.title: Keith Jackson: Legendary college football broadcaster dies
item.description: Keith Jackson, who was widely regarded by several generations as the voice synonymous with college football, has died. He was 89.
item.media:description: Keith Jackson, who was widely regarded by several generations as the voice synonymous with college football, has died. He was 89.
item.media:title: Keith Jackson: Legendary college football broadcaster dies

item.title: Reports: Patriots RB Rex Burkhead, Mike Gillislee out vs. Titans
item.description: New England Patriots running backs Rex Burkhead and Mike Gillislee are expected to sit out Saturday's AFC divisional round playoff game.
item.media:description: New England Patriots running backs Rex Burkhead and Mike Gillislee are expected to sit out Saturday's AFC divisional round playoff game.

item.title: NFL to consider Cam Newton knee injury during probe
item.description: The NFL is considering a knee injury that may have contributed to quarterback Cam Newton's fall.
item.media:description: The NFL is considering a knee injury that may have contributed to quarterback Cam Newton's fall.
item.media:title: NFL to consider Cam Newton knee injury during probe

item.title: San Francisco 49ers LB Reuben Foster arrested for marijuana possession
item.description: San Francisco 49ers linebacker Reuben Foster was arrested and charged with second-degree marijuana possession on Friday.
item.media:description: San Francisco 49ers linebacker Reuben Foster was arrested and charged with second-degree marijuana possession on Friday.
item.media:title: San Francisco 49ers LB Reuben Foster arrested for marijuana possession

item.title: Pregnant women prescribed UTI pills linked to birth defects
item.description: Urinary tract infections, or UTIs, can be problematic for pregnant women and their babies, but so can two antibiotics used to treat these infections.
item.media:description: Urinary tract infections, or UTIs, can be problematic for pregnant women and their babies, but so can two antibiotics used to treat these infections.
item.media:title: Pregnant women prescribed UTI pills linked to birth defects

item.title: Documents: Las Vegas gunman attempted to avoid detection
item.description: The man who killed 58 people and wounded more than 500 others this fall on the Las Vegas Strip took elaborate steps to avoid being detected by authorities.
item.media:description: The man who killed 58 people and wounded more than 500 others this fall on the Las Vegas Strip took elaborate steps to avoid being detected by authorities.
item.media:title: Documents: Las Vegas gunman attempted to avoid detection

item.title: State police report: Civilians stepped on evidence at Sandy Hook
item.description: Civilians and police disturbed evidence, including bullet casings, after Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting where 26 died, according to state police report.
item.media:description: Civilians and police disturbed evidence, including bullet casings, after Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting where 26 died, according to state police report.
item.media:title: State police report: Civilians stepped on evidence at Sandy Hook

item.title: Starz sets premiere dates for 'Vida,' 'Sweetbitter,' 'Howards End'
item.description: The British miniseries "Howards End," starring Hayley Atwell and Matthew Macfadyen, is to premiere on Starz April 8.

item.title: 'Greatest Showman' is No. 1 on the U.S. album chart
item.description: The soundtrack from Hugh Jackman's movie musical "The Greatest Showman" is No. 1 on the U.S. album chart.

item.title: 'Swatting hoax' suspect charged with involuntary manslaughter
item.description: A Los Angeles man accused of making a hoax call -- known as "swatting" -- that led police to kill a man in Wichita has been charged with involuntary murder.
item.media:description: A Los Angeles man accused of making a hoax call -- known as "swatting" -- that led police to kill a man in Wichita has been charged with involuntary murder.
item.media:title: 'Swatting hoax' suspect charged with involuntary manslaughter
